intro: Eriosyce aurata, commonly known as the golden star cactus, is a species of cactus native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and dense covering of white, woolly hairs that give it a soft, fuzzy appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the warmer months, which are often surrounded by the same fuzzy covering. Eriosyce aurata is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. It is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation due to its ornamental appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
